page.title: 01Block ref. 04480453 (Part 1)
page.content:
This block is in the{Vale of York about 7 miles West of the city, straddling the main A59 road and BR line between {York}and{Knaresborough.} The land is extremely flat and almost entirely devoted to arable farming. The survey was carried out in November 1985 so many fields were lying ploughed and bare. What crops were sown were primarily sugar beet (there is a processing plant a few miles away) and winter wheat. Much of the rest of the land is given over to grassland, either intensively managed or rough grazing. The Southern border of the block includes part of{Marston Moor}which was the site of an important Civil War battle in 1644, resulting in a key victory for Parliamentary forces.
{(more on p.2)
